name: Minhyuk Sung
content: Minhyuk Sung Minhyuk Sung Associate Professor School of Computing Graduate School of AI KAIST KAIST Visual AI Group Contact Information E3-5, Rm 507, KAIST 291 Daehak-ro, Yuseong-gu, Daejeon, South Korea 34141 Tel: (+82)-042-350-3587 Courses CS492(C): Diffusion and Flow Models Fall 2025 CS479: Machine Learning for 3D Data Spring 2025 CS492(D): Diffusion Models and Their Applications Fall 2024 More I am an associate professor in the School of Computing at KAIST, leading the KAIST Visual AI Group. I am also affiliated with the Graduate School of AI and the Metaverse Program. Before joining KAIST, I was a research scientist at Adobe Research. I received my Ph.D. from Stanford University, advised by Leonidas Guibas, and received M.S. and B.S. degrees from KAIST. My research focuses on generating, manipulating, and analyzing various visual data, including images, videos, and 3D data. I’m the recipient of the Asiapgraphics Researcher Award in 2024.I am looking for motivated students to join my group. Please reach out to me via email if you are interested in.Information for Prospective Students Announcements Call for Internship for Winter 2025-2026: We are currently seeking undergraduate interns to join our group this winter. Click here for more details. News Nov 2025 Serving as an area chair at ICML 2026. Nov 2025 One paper has been accepted to 3DV 2026. Nov 2025 One paper has been accepted to WACV 2026 (in the secound round). Oct 2025 Serving as a technical paper committee member at SIGGRAPH 2026. Sep 2025 Five papers have been accepted to NeurIPS 2025, including one spotlight. Sep 2025 One paper has been accepted to WACV 2026 (in the first round). Aug 2025 I talked about "The Present and Future of Content Generation" at the KAIST AI Transformation Workshop. Click to check out the recording. Aug 2025 I gave talks at NVIDIA, Google, Stanford, and SFU titled "Inference-Time Guided Generation Using Diffusion and Flow Models". Click to download the slides. Aug 2025 Serving as an area chair at ICLR 2026. Jul 2025 I gave lectures on diffusion models at MLSS-Senegal 2025.
